trans-unit.source: The <codeph>SQLJ.REMOVE_JAR</codeph> system procedure removes a jar file from a database.

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>SQLJ.REMOVE_JAR</codeph> system procedure removes a jar file from a database.

target.mrk: The <codeph>SQLJ.REMOVE_JAR</codeph> system procedure removes a jar file from a database.

trans-unit.source: SQLJ.REMOVE_JAR(IN QUALIFIED_JAR_NAME VARCHAR(32672), IN UNDEPLOY INTEGER)

seg-source.mrk: SQLJ.REMOVE_JAR(IN QUALIFIED_JAR_NAME VARCHAR(32672), IN UNDEPLOY INTEGER)

target.mrk: SQLJ.REMOVE_JAR(IN QUALIFIED_JAR_NAME VARCHAR(32672), IN UNDEPLOY INTEGER)

trans-unit.source: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> name of the jar file, qualified by the schema name. Two examples:

seg-source.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> name of the jar file, qualified by the schema name.

target.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> name of the jar file, qualified by the schema name.

trans-unit.source: If set to 1, indicates the existence of an SQLJ deployment descriptor file. <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> ignores this argument, so it is normally set to 0.

seg-source.mrk: If set to 1, indicates the existence of an SQLJ deployment descriptor file.
<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> ignores this argument, so it is normally set to 0.

target.mrk: If set to 1, indicates the existence of an SQLJ deployment descriptor file.
<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> ignores this argument, so it is normally set to 0.

trans-unit.source: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this procedure by default. See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information. The database owner can grant access to other users.

See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.
The database owner can grant access to other users.
